intro: Psychotria lyciiflora, commonly known as the "Mexican morning glory," is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 14,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows as a shrub or vine, often found in moist, shaded habitats. Psychotria lyciiflora is also noted for its use in traditional medicine and as an ornamental plant.
